# Python-Markdown Extra Extension

## Overview

The Python-Markdown Extra extension is a convenience wrapper that bundles multiple individual Markdown extensions to provide functionality similar to [PHP Markdown Extra](http://michelf.com/projects/php-markdown/extra/). Instead of loading each extension individually, this single extension loads all the commonly used extensions at once.

## Purpose

- **Convenience**: Simplifies the process of enabling multiple Markdown extensions
- **Compatibility**: Provides feature parity with PHP Markdown Extra
- **Standardization**: Offers a consistent set of enhanced Markdown features

## Included Extensions

The Extra extension automatically loads the following individual extensions:

- `fenced_code` - Enables fenced code blocks with syntax highlighting
- `footnotes` - Adds support for footnotes
- `attr_list` - Allows adding HTML attributes to Markdown elements
- `def_list` - Supports definition lists
- `tables` - Enables table syntax
- `abbr` - Adds abbreviation support
- `md_in_html` - Allows Markdown syntax within HTML blocks

## Important Classes and Functions

### `ExtraExtension` Class

```python
class ExtraExtension(Extension):
    """ Add various extensions to Markdown class."""
```

**Key Methods:**

- `__init__(self, **kwargs)`: 
  - Accepts configuration parameters for the bundled extensions
  - Stores configuration in `self.config` for later use

- `extendMarkdown(self, md)`:
  - Core method that registers all included extensions with the Markdown instance
  - Passes through any configuration options to the individual extensions

### `makeExtension()` Function

```python
def makeExtension(**kwargs):
    return ExtraExtension(**kwargs)
```

Standard factory function for creating extension instances. This follows the Python-Markdown extension pattern.

## Usage Example

```python
import markdown

# Using the Extra extension
md = markdown.Markdown(extensions=['extra'])

# With configuration options
md = markdown.Markdown(
    extensions=['extra'],
    extension_configs={
        'extra': {
            # Configuration options for individual extensions
            'fenced_code': {'use_pygments': True},
            'tables': {'use_align_attribute': True}
        }
    }
)
```

## Important Notes

⚠️ **Dependencies**: All individual extensions must be available on your `PYTHONPATH`. This extension doesn't include the actual extension code—it only provides a convenient way to load them together.

⚠️ **Customization Warning**: While you can modify the `extensions` global variable to include additional extensions, such changes may be lost during Python-Markdown upgrades. For custom extension bundles, consider creating your own extension under a different name.

⚠️ **Scope Limitation**: This extension only includes extensions that have equivalents in PHP Markdown Extra. Other Python-Markdown extensions are intentionally excluded to maintain compatibility.

## Configuration

Configuration options are passed through to the individual extensions. Refer to each extension's documentation for specific configuration options:

- [Fenced Code](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/fenced_code_blocks/)
- [Footnotes](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/footnotes/)
- [Attribute Lists](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/attr_list/)
- [Definition Lists](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/definition_lists/)
- [Tables](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/tables/)
- [Abbreviations](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/abbreviations/)
- [Markdown in HTML](https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/md_in_html/)
